summary_reasoning: This report demonstrates strong originality through multiple company-specific syntheses that go well beyond generic industry commentary. The analyst provides quantified projections linking GLP-1 market dynamics to specific financial outcomes ($80 billion Lilly market capture from $200+ billion total market by 2031, with net prices declining from $7,000 to $3,000 annually). The integration of competitive positioning analysis (60% Zepbound prescription share gains vs Novo Nordisk), pipeline differentiation (orforglipron's manufacturing advantages and $20 billion sales potential), and policy risk quantification (24% revenue hit scenario from price benchmarking) represents sophisticated synthesis work. The margin expansion thesis connecting high-margin drug launches to operating leverage (low-30s to mid-40s operating margins) provides actionable investment insight with clear catalysts and timelines.

insights_classified.text: GLP-1 market reaching $200+ billion by 2031 with Lilly capturing $80 billion
Net prices declining from $7,000 to $3,000 annually as volumes increase
Zepbound gaining 60% US prescription share, up 13 percentage points
Orforglipron's small molecule manufacturing advantages for global distribution
Operating margins expanding from low-30s to mid-40s through drug mix shift
Two-thirds of sales from GLP-1 drugs by 2032 with patent protection until 2036
